raw_text: We turned to TextRunner (Yates et al,2007) as a large source of background knowledge about pre-existing relations between nominals
clean_text: We turned to TextRunner (Yates et al, 2007) as a large source of background knowledge about pre-existing relations between nominals.

raw_text: Yates (2009) considers the output from an open information extraction system (Yates et al, 2007) and clusters predicates and arguments using string similarity and a combination of constraints
clean_text: Yates (2009) considers the output from an open information extraction system (Yates et al, 2007) and clusters predicates and arguments using string similarity and a combination of constraints.

citing_paper_authors: Jean-Yves, Delort | Guillermo, Garrido | Enrique, Alfonseca | Katja, Filippova
raw_text: Two example systems implementing this paradigm are TEXTRUN NER (Yates et al, 2007) and REVERB (Fader et al, 2011)
clean_text: Two example systems implementing this paradigm are TEXTRUNNER (Yates et al, 2007) and REVERB (Fader et al, 2011).

raw_text: In contrast, when research focuses on any relation, as in TextRunner (Yates et al, 2007), there is no standardized manner for re-using the pattern learned
clean_text: In contrast, when research focuses on any relation, as in TextRunner (Yates et al, 2007), there is no standardized manner for re-using the pattern learned.

raw_text: The on line demo of TextRunner2 (Yates et al, 2007) actually allowed us to collect the arguments for all our semantic relations
clean_text: The online demo of TextRunner (Yates et al, 2007) actually allowed us to collect the arguments for all our semantic relations.
